result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian F. Konkol was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. Defendant is eligible for Electronic Monitoring if approved by the risk assessment and jail administration. - stayed

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Comply with injunction order in 15CV11. 
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian F. Konkol

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian F. Konkol in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. W/H Sentence Probation for the length of the injunction order in 15CV11. Pay $200 fine + costs. Defense free to argue length of probation.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Victim was notified and her attorney Atty Paul is present.
Court questions Atty Paul.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Redfield concur in part with the recommendation but requests a 1 yr probation period w/early discharge. 

BY THE COURT:********PROBATION*****
I/S Sentence:  30 days jail w/huber - Huber if approved by jail administration. 
Defendant is eligible for Electronic Monitoring if approved by the risk assessment and jail administration. - stayed
2 yrs Probation:
Conditions: 
Comply with injunction order in 15CV11. 
Pay $200 fine + costs + domestic abuse surcharge.  
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Comply with the terms of the injunction in 15CV11.

Defendant Brian F. Konkol in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court enters NOT GUILTY plea on defendant's behalf.

State recommends a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
